definition: you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])

sentences.english: Avoid mini skirts, too much make up, and excessive jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 避免迷你裙，化太浓的妆和过多的首饰。

sentences.english: Mini-skirts were in fashion last summer.
Lydia always comes to work in a—mini-skirt and high heels.
sentences.chinese: 莉蒂雅总是穿着性感迷你裙和高跟鞋来上班。

sentences.english: She wore a backless top and a mini skirt.
sentences.chinese: 她穿了一件露背装还有迷你裙。

sentences.english: You can't wear that to the party! Miniskirts went out years ago.
sentences.chinese: 你不能穿那身去参加晚会，迷你裙几年前就过时了。

sentences.english: Fashion wise it also meant that wearing mini skirts was out.
sentences.chinese: 时尚有知，这意味着穿迷你裙out了。

sentences.english: Where is the miniskirt displayed on the manikin?
sentences.chinese: 模特身上展示的这条迷你裙在哪儿？

sentences.english: I want to buy a pair of tall boots to go with this miniskirt.
sentences.chinese: 我想买一双高筒靴来配这件迷你裙。

sentences.english: Yes, for girls there are tight-fitting short-sleeved shirt and low waist miniskirt.
sentences.chinese: 是的，女生们穿紧身短袖衬衫和低腰迷你裙。

sentences.english: It's cold outside. I just can't wear my miniskirt.
sentences.chinese: 外面太冷了，我不能穿迷你裙。

sentences.english: That chick is super hot in that mini-skirt.
sentences.chinese: 那个马子穿那件迷你裙超辣的。

sentences.english: How do you think it goes with a  miniskirt?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得这配一件迷你裙怎么样？

sentences.english: As far as I’m concerned, I don’t mind that you wear this mini-skirt.
sentences.chinese: 就我个人而言，我不介意你穿这件迷你裙。

sentences.english: One day, at a bus stop there was a girl who was wearing a skintight miniskirt.
sentences.chinese: 一天，一个身着紧身迷你裙的女子在公车站等车。

sentences.english: Mini-skirts were in fashion last summer.
